post.description: Provides a human-readable explanation of the provided code, describing what it does step by step.

data.result: This code creates a debounce utility function. It takes a function (fn) and a delay in milliseconds (ms). It returns a new function that delays invoking fn until ms milliseconds have passed since the last time the returned function was called. Each new call resets the timer, ensuring fn is only executed once the calls have stopped for the specified duration.

post.description: Generates a SQL query from a natural language description. Optionally specify the SQL dialect.

example.prompt: Get all users who signed up in the last 30 days and have made at least one purchase

data.result:
SELECT u.*
FROM users u
INNER JOIN purchases p ON u.id = p.user_id
WHERE u.created_at >= NOW() - INTERVAL '30 days'
GROUP BY u.id
HAVING COUNT(p.id) >= 1;
